Articles.Content: What happened to this mod? The <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> was blanked.

<abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> was edited on march 8th. Perhaps sigma is working on the update and wants to start a new thread

if you are interested in this (or any of my mods) the only place to find info / get support from now will be github.com/Sigma88

I'm not using the forum to promote my mods anymore.

it has proven to be useless as I got zero feedback out of it

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Sigma88 said:
> 
> 
> it has proven to be useless as I got zero feedback out of it
> 

Well I can understand why you feel this way as in 99.9% of the time, people will not give any feedback unless something get broken. I often find that something  is broken but no one bothered reporting it, so your not alone in this feeling. Still I know that many players used your mods, not only for play but also for usucational purposes which you should not underestimate. Despite the neglect, I still think you should not punish the community as a whole as there are surely many players that did appreciate your work which should not go to waste, which would be a real pitty.

Despite the neglect, I still think you should not punish the community as a whole as there are surely many players that did appreciate your work which should not go to waste, which would be a real pitty.

I would hardly call it "punishing" when I am providing free content ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

link is in my sig, any good boy knows what to do

Hello!

I’m aware that the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> is no longer maintaining the thread, I’m just asking the community of users a question:

Is it possible to have galactic neighbourhood and another (unsupported) star system (like the old Interstellar Adventure Revived) coexist in the same save?
